_documentation.version_control: This field tracks the version of the assessment template
_documentation.structure_overview: This template defines the structure for all assessments in the system

question_rules.scoring: Scores must range from 1-5, where 1 is most positive
question_rules.categories: Each question must have a category and contribute to primaryCategory

recommendation_rules.levels: Must include: very-high, high, medium, low, very-low
recommendation_rules.format: Use lowercase with hyphens for all recommendation levels

threshold_rules.labels: Must use consistent labels: very-high, high, medium, low, very-low
threshold_rules.displayText: Each threshold must have a user-friendly displayText

specific_recommendations.title: Must be 'Specific Recommendations'
specific_recommendations.icon: Must be a valid icon name

general_recommendations.title: Must be 'General Recommendations'
general_recommendations.icon: Must be a valid icon name

naming.categories: Use Title Case for category names (e.g., 'Stress Management')
naming.recommendations: Use lowercase with hyphens for recommendation levels
naming.results_sections: Use consistent titles: 'Specific Recommendations' and 'General Recommendations'

content.options: Ensure options are mutually exclusive and cover the full range
content.results_sections: Keep section titles consistent across all assessments

scoring.consistency: Maintain consistent scoring across all questions
scoring.direction: 1 is always the most positive/desired response
scoring.categories: Each question should contribute to both its category and primaryCategory

common_pitfalls: Don't mix case styles in recommendation levels
Ensure all placeholder text is replaced

complete_question.text: How do your leaders typically respond to unexpected changes or disruptions?

options.text: Often resist change and struggle to adapt plans
Accept change reluctantly but have difficulty adjusting strategies
Adapt to change adequately but could improve flexibility
Generally embrace change and adjust plans accordingly
View change as opportunity and quickly pivot strategies when needed

base: Focus on developing an agile mindset before implementing specific practices
Build a culture of psychological safety to enable experimentation
Ensure leaders model the behaviors they wish to see in their teams
very-high: Implement a comprehensive agile leadership development program
Establish regular leadership retrospectives to drive continuous improvement
Create clear metrics for measuring leadership effectiveness in agility
Partner leaders with agile coaches for personalized development

needLevel.label: very-high
needLevel.displayText: There is a very high chance your team could benefit from agile leadership training

needLevel.label: high
needLevel.displayText: There is a high chance your team could benefit from agile leadership training

scorecardInfo.title: Agile Leadership Metrics
scorecardInfo.shortDescription: Evaluate your organization's agile leadership capabilities and identify improvement opportunities

update_instructions.new_scorecard: 1. Copy the complete_scorecard example. 2. Update all fields with your specific values. 3. Ensure the id is unique and in kebab-case. 4. Add the scorecard to the scorecards array.
update_instructions.update_scorecard: 1. Locate the existing scorecard in the scorecards array. 2. Update the relevant fields while maintaining the structure. 3. Ensure all required fields are present. 4. Verify the id remains unchanged.
update_instructions.validation: After creating or updating a scorecard, verify: 1. All required fields are present. 2. The id is unique and properly formatted. 3. The title and category use Title Case. 4. The visibility field is a boolean.

test_sync: This field should be added to all JSONs
_setup_instructions: IMPORTANT SETUP INSTRUCTIONS: 1. Replace all placeholder values marked with ${...}. 2. For each question in your assessment, add a corresponding category in questionRecommendations. 3. Ensure primaryCategory is set to your main scoring category. 4. Use the question's category name exactly as it appears in the questions section. 5. Each question should contribute to both its own category score and the primaryCategory score. 6. The paths in nextRoute should include the assessment ID (e.g., '/survey/your-assessment-id'). 7. Remove this _setup_instructions field when done.
_question_standardization: QUESTION STANDARDIZATION RULES: 1. All assessments must have exactly 12 questions. 2. All questions must be in English. 3. Question scoring follows this pattern: a) Each question has 5 options. b) Options are scored from 1 to 5, where 1 is the most positive/desired response and 5 is the least positive/desired response. c) Each option contributes to both its specific category score and the primaryCategory score. d) The scoring should be consistent across all questions in the assessment.

intro.title: Conflict Resolution Assessment
intro.subtitle: Evaluate your team's conflict management capabilities and identify opportunities for improvement

instructions.title: How to Complete This Assessment
steps: Answer each question honestly based on your observations of your team's conflict handling
Consider the organization's overall culture and communication patterns
Reflect on recent conflict situations and their resolutions
Submit your assessment to receive personalized recommendations

columns.title: Why This Matters
columns.content: Effective conflict resolution skills are essential for maintaining team cohesion, productivity, and employee satisfaction. Understanding your organization's conflict management approach helps identify areas for improvement.

points.description: How team members express concerns and address disagreements
The prevalence and types of conflicts in your organization
Current approaches to mediating and resolving conflicts
How well conflicts are resolved and lessons integrated

intro.consentText: By completing this assessment, you agree to provide information about your team's conflict management practices to help identify areas for improvement.

items.text: How often do unresolved conflicts impact productivity in your team?

options.text: Very rarely or never
Occasionally (a few times a year)
Sometimes (monthly)
Often (weekly)
Very frequently (daily)

items.text: When conflicts arise, how do most team members communicate their concerns?

options.text: Open, direct, and constructive communication
Mostly direct but sometimes emotional
Hesitant to address issues directly
Indirect or passive-aggressive communication
Combative or avoidant communication

items.text: How are conflicts typically resolved in your organization?

options.text: Through structured mediation and collaborative problem-solving
Usually through discussion but without formal processes
Sometimes addressed but often without clear resolution
Often by management decisions without addressing underlying issues
Rarely resolved effectively; conflicts tend to persist

items.text: What typically happens after conflicts are addressed?

options.text: Improved relationships and positive organizational changes
Resolution occurs but without significant improvement
Surface-level resolution with lingering tension
Temporary solutions that don't address root causes
Ongoing resentment and recurring similar conflicts

items.text: What level of conflict resolution training have team members received?

options.text: Comprehensive training for all team members
Basic training for most team members
Some training for managers only
Minimal or outdated training
No formal conflict resolution training

_scoring_notes.primaryCategory: This is the main category used for overall assessment scoring
_scoring_notes.recommendations: Recommendations are organized by need level
_scoring_notes.thresholds: Thresholds determine the recommendation level based on scores
_scoring_notes.results_sections: Keep section titles consistent: 'Specific Recommendations' and 'General Recommendations'

base: Establish clear communication channels for addressing concerns
Document conflict resolution procedures and make them accessible
Recognize and reward constructive conflict resolution behaviors
Very High Need: Implement comprehensive conflict resolution training for all staff
Engage professional mediators for existing high-stakes conflicts
Establish formal mediation processes with trained internal mediators
Conduct team workshops focusing on communication and empathy skills
High Need: Provide conflict resolution training to managers and team leaders
Introduce structured conflict resolution frameworks for team use
Develop clear escalation pathways for unresolved conflicts
Implement regular check-ins focused on team dynamics and potential conflicts
Moderate Need: Offer optional conflict resolution workshops for interested staff
Provide managers with basic mediation skills training
Create guidelines for productive disagreement in meetings
Establish peer support systems for addressing minor conflicts
Low Need: Reinforce existing successful conflict resolution strategies
Share case studies of effectively resolved conflicts as examples
Incorporate conflict resolution refreshers in team building activities
Recognize and celebrate constructive conflict resolution examples
Very Low Need: Document current effective conflict resolution practices
Include conflict resolution approaches in onboarding for new team members
Periodically review conflict resolution procedures to ensure continued effectiveness
Share your organization's conflict resolution expertise with industry partners

primary_category.title: Training Need Assessment
primary_category.description: Evaluation of your organization's need for conflict resolution training

high: Your team demonstrates significant challenges in addressing conflicts constructively
Current conflict resolution approaches are often ineffective or counterproductive
medium: Your team has some conflict resolution skills but lacks consistency
There are gaps in how conflicts are addressed across different teams or situations
low: Your team generally handles conflicts effectively
There are established processes that work well for most conflict situations

high: Prioritize comprehensive conflict resolution training for all staff members
Develop formal conflict resolution protocols and mediation resources
medium: Target specific areas for conflict resolution skill development
Strengthen existing conflict resolution frameworks with additional tools
low: Maintain and document current effective conflict resolution practices
Consider advanced training for specific complex conflict situations

secondary_category.title: Communication Patterns
secondary_category.description: Analysis of how team members express and address concerns

high: Communication during conflicts is often ineffective or harmful
Team members struggle to express concerns constructively
medium: Communication varies in effectiveness depending on the situation
Some team members communicate well while others struggle
low: Team communication during conflicts is generally constructive
There are established norms for expressing concerns appropriately

high: Focus on developing active listening and nonviolent communication skills
Establish clear guidelines for addressing concerns respectfully
medium: Provide targeted communication training for specific team members
Create frameworks for structured difficult conversations
low: Document and share effective communication practices across teams

report_structure.title: Conflict Resolution Training Assessment
report_structure.description: Analysis of your organization's conflict management practices and recommendations for improvement

critical_focus.title: Priority Focus Areas
critical_focus.description: These areas require immediate attention to improve conflict resolution outcomes

development_opportunities.title: Development Opportunities
development_opportunities.description: These areas present opportunities to strengthen conflict management capabilities

implementation_strategy.title: Implementation Strategy
implementation_strategy.description: Recommended approach for introducing conflict resolution improvements
recommendations: Begin with a pilot program in one department or team to demonstrate value
Involve key stakeholders in designing the conflict resolution approach
Establish clear metrics to measure impact of conflict resolution improvements
Create regular feedback mechanisms to refine the approach
Plan for ongoing reinforcement of conflict resolution skills

support_resources.title: Support Resources
support_resources.description: Additional resources to help implement conflict resolution improvements
recommendations: Consider certification for internal mediators to develop in-house expertise
Evaluate conflict resolution training providers with experience in your industry
Explore conflict management software tools for documenting and tracking issues
Develop case studies based on successfully resolved conflicts in your organization
Create a resource library of conflict resolution techniques and templates

Category Name.high: ${Replace with high priority recommendation for this category}
Category Name.medium: ${Replace with medium priority recommendation for this category}
Category Name.low: ${Replace with low priority recommendation for this category}

Another Category.high: ${Replace with high priority recommendation for this category}
Another Category.medium: ${Replace with medium priority recommendation for this category}
Another Category.low: ${Replace with low priority recommendation for this category}

Conflict Frequency.high: Implement regular conflict resolution checkpoints to address issues before they escalate
Conflict Frequency.medium: Create early intervention processes for addressing conflicts when first identified
Conflict Frequency.low: Maintain your effective approach to preventing persistent conflicts

Communication.high: Provide training on constructive feedback and difficult conversations
Communication.medium: Develop communication guidelines for addressing conflicts respectfully
Communication.low: Document and share your effective communication practices

Resolution Strategies.high: Establish structured conflict resolution frameworks and procedures
Resolution Strategies.medium: Refine existing approaches with more formalized resolution methods
Resolution Strategies.low: Continue using your effective resolution strategies

Outcomes.high: Implement follow-up procedures to ensure conflicts are fully resolved
Outcomes.medium: Create mechanisms to monitor the effectiveness of conflict resolutions
Outcomes.low: Continue your successful conflict resolution processes

Training.high: Implement comprehensive conflict resolution training for all team members
Training.medium: Enhance existing training with more specific conflict management techniques
Training.low: Maintain your current effective training approaches

Training Need.high: Prioritize organization-wide conflict resolution training and establish formal mediation processes
Training Need.medium: Provide targeted conflict management training for key team members
Training Need.low: Consider specialized training for complex conflict scenarios

needLevel.label: very-high
needLevel.displayText: There is a very high chance your team could benefit from this training

needLevel.label: high
needLevel.displayText: There is a high chance your team could benefit from this training

needLevel.label: medium
needLevel.displayText: There is a moderate chance your team could benefit from this training

needLevel.label: low
needLevel.displayText: There is a low chance your team could benefit from this training

needLevel.label: very-low
needLevel.displayText: There is a very low chance your team could benefit from this training

summaries.text: Your organization demonstrates a critical need for conflict resolution training. Current approaches are likely causing significant productivity losses and team friction.
Your team shows substantial room for improvement in conflict management. Targeted training could significantly enhance workplace harmony and productivity.
Your organization has moderate conflict resolution capabilities but would benefit from additional structure and skill development in specific areas.
Your team demonstrates good conflict resolution practices with some opportunities for refinement and consistency.
Your organization exhibits strong conflict resolution capabilities. Focus on documenting and sustaining these effective practices.

thankYou.title: Thank You for Completing the Conflict Views Assessment
thankYou.message: We've analyzed your responses and prepared recommendations to enhance conflict resolution in your organization.
thankYou.nextSteps: You'll receive a detailed report with specific strategies tailored to your organization's needs. Consider scheduling a follow-up consultation to discuss implementation options.
